unalcol.random.rngpack

Class RanMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.random.raw.RawGenerator
      • unalcol.random.raw.SeedableGenerator
        • unalcol.random.rngpack.RanMT

  • public class RanMT
extends SeedableGenerator
    Mersenne Twister -- advanced pseudorandom generator with a period of 219937-1

    Source code is available.

    This class is a ported version of the Paul Houle's RngPack 1.1a implementation

    License

    Ported to the unalcol library by Jonatan Gomez from a work copyright (c) 2003 by Paul Houle.
    Derived from a work copyright (c) 2003 by Sean Luke.

    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RanMT()
      Creates a RanMT generator with a time dependent seed (using the current time)
      RanMT(java.util.Date d)
      Creates a RanMT generator with the given time dependent seed
      RanMT(int[] array)
      If a 32 bit seed isn't enough for you, you can pass an array of 624 integers.
      RanMT(long seed)
      Creates a RanMT generator with the given seed

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long initSeed(long _seed)
      Returns a seed calculated from a given seed
      RawGenerator new_instance()
      Creates a new instance of the RanMT generator
      double next()
      Generates a random number in the interval [0.0,1.0) following a uniform distribution x~U[0,1), using the RanMT approach

      • RanMT

        public RanMT(java.util.Date d)
        Creates a RanMT generator with the given time dependent seed
        Parameters:
        seed - The time information used for defining the seed

      • RanMT

        public RanMT(int[] array)
        If a 32 bit seed isn't enough for you, you can pass an array of 624 integers. Any array of integers is fine so long as they aren't all zero.

        public double next()
        Generates a random number in the interval [0.0,1.0) following a uniform distribution x~U[0,1), using the RanMT approach
